body_html: Not too much, but it would mirror Python syntax more closely. Will ATen really fail at compile time if your Scalar is float but you call .toCInt()? I thought it was type erased in a way that it would only fail at runtime (or do the proper conversion.
body_text: Not too much, but it would mirror Python syntax more closely. Will ATen really fail at compile time if your Scalar is float but you call .toCInt()? I thought it was type erased in a way that it would only fail at runtime (or do the proper conversion.
body: Not too much, but it would mirror Python syntax more closely. Will ATen really fail at compile time if your Scalar is float but you call .toCInt()? I thought it was type erased in a way that it would only fail at runtime (or do the proper conversion.
